meanings.definition: Make or become accustomed or used to something.
meanings.sent1: She habituates to waking up early every morning.
meanings.sent2: He habituates to the noise of the city after living there for years.
meanings.sent3: The cat habituates to the sound of the can opener, knowing it means food.
meanings.sent4: Like a plant habituating to sunlight, she slowly adjusted to her new routine.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive practice habituates her to the dance moves, making them second nature.

meanings.definition: Accustom or become accustomed to a particular situation or practice.
meanings.sent1: They habituate to the cold weather by wearing warm clothes.
meanings.sent2: The students habituate to the school schedule after a few weeks.
meanings.sent3: He habituates to the taste of coffee by adding more sugar each day.
meanings.sent4: Just like a bird habituates to its cage, she got used to her new job.
meanings.sent5: The athlete habituates to the intense training, pushing themselves to new limits.
